cards.title: Relationships between Roots and Coefficients
details: Recall and use the relations between the roots and coefficients of polynomial equations of degree 2, 3, or 4
Evaluate symmetric functions of the roots
Solve problems involving unknown coefficients

cards.title: Transforming Equations by Substitution
details: Use substitutions to obtain new equations whose roots are related in a simple way to those of the original equation

cards.title: Sketching Rational Functions
details: Sketch graphs of simple rational functions, including determination of oblique asymptotes
Identify significant features such as turning points, asymptotes, and intersections

cards.title: Relationships among Graphs
details: Understand and use relationships between the graphs of y = f(x), y^2 = f(x), y = 1/f(x), y = f(|x|), and y = |f(x)|
Use sketch graphs to solve equations or inequalities

cards.title: Standard Results and Method of Differences
details: Use standard results for summing r, r^2, and r^3
Use the method of differences to obtain the sum of a finite series
Use partial fractions when necessary

cards.title: Convergence of Series
details: Recognise convergence by direct consideration of a sum to n terms
Find the sum to infinity in such cases

cards.title: Matrix Operations and Properties
details: Perform matrix addition, subtraction, and multiplication (including non-square matrices)
Recognise zero and identity matrices
Understand singular and non-singular matrices

cards.title: Determinants, Inverses, and Transformations
details: Calculate determinants and find inverses of 2x2 and 3x3 matrices
Understand (AB)^(-1) = B^(-1)A^(-1) for non-singular matrices
Represent geometric transformations in the x-y plane using 2x2 matrices

cards.title: Invariant Points and Lines
details: Understand the meaning of invariance as applied to points and lines under matrix transformations
Solve problems involving invariant points and lines

cards.title: Cartesian and Polar Coordinates
details: Understand and convert between Cartesian and polar forms
Sketch simple polar curves, showing key features and symmetry

cards.title: Area in Polar Coordinates
details: Recall and use the formula (1/2)∫r^2 dθ for the area of a sector
Apply the formula in simple cases

cards.title: Equations of Planes and Vector Products
details: Use equations of a plane in forms ax + by + cz = d, r·n = p, or r = a + λb + μc
Convert between forms as needed
Recall and use the vector (cross) product and its component form

cards.title: Lines and Planes in Space
details: Use equations of lines and planes to solve problems concerning distances, angles, and intersections
Determine relationships between lines and planes (e.g., parallelism, intersection, perpendicularity)
Calculate the shortest distance between two skew lines

cards.title: Mathematical Induction
details: Use the method of mathematical induction to establish results
Recognise when conjecture and inductive proof is a useful strategy
